org.cobogw.gwt.user.client.ui
Class Rating

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              org.cobogw.gwt.user.client.ui.Rating
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener
public class Rating
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite

The Rating Widget provides an intuitive rating experience that allows users to select the number of stars (or other custom images) that represents their rating. At construction the initial rating, the maximum rating to allow, the orientation of the stars, and custom images for the different states a star can have can be set. The Rating Widget can be made read only, and the behavior to have the current selection remain visible during hovering can be set. Rating also supports event handling that allows custom code to run after the user has rated something.

CSS Style Rules

  • .cbg-Rating { the Rating Widget itself }
  • .cbg-RatingItem { the image item, e.g. the star}

Default Rating Images

When no custom image is used the default images are used. The base image (original name star.png) is from Silk Icons, http://www.famfamfam.com/lab/icons/silk/ a great set of icons licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 2.5 License. Available images:
  • cbg-star.png the selected item.
  • cbg-stardeselected.png the unselected item.
  • cbg-starhover.png the item hovered.
The cbg-stardeselected.png was created from the base image by setting lightness to 80 and cbg-starhover.png was created by setting lightness to -80.

Field Detail

LTR

public static final int LTR
Orientation of Rating widget Horizontal from Left to Right (default). With lowest rating left and highest rating right.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RTL

public static final int RTL
Orientation of Rating widget Horizontal from Right to Left. With highest rating left and lowest rating right.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TTB

public static final int TTB
Orientation of Rating widget Vertical from Top to Bottom. With lowest rating at top and highest rating at bottom.

Constructor Detail

Rating

public Rating(int initRating,
              int maxRating)
Creates a Horizontal Left to Right (LTR) widget which contains the number of selections maxRating with initial value initRating and uses the default rating icons.

Parameters:
initRating - Initial value of the rating
maxRating - Maximum rating value

Rating

public Rating(int initRating,
              int maxRating,
              int orientation)
Creates a custom oriented rating widget which contains the number of selections maxRating with initial value initRating and uses the default rating icons.

Parameters:
initRating - Initial value of the rating
maxRating - Maximum rating value
orientation - Orientation of widget: LTR, RTL, TTB or TTB.

Rating

public Rating(int initRating,
              int maxRating,
              int orientation,
              java.lang.String selectedImg,
              java.lang.String deselectedImg,
              java.lang.String hoverImg,
              int width,
              int height)
Creates a custom oriented rating widget which contains the number of selections maxRating with initial value initRating and uses the specified images as indicators, with the given width and height, which should apply for all three images.

Parameters:
initRating - Initial value of the rating
maxRating - Maximum rating value
orientation - Orientation of widget: LTR, RTL, TTB or TTB.
selectedImg - Image on Rating item when selected
deselectedImg - Image on Rating item when not selected
hoverImg - Image on selected Rating item when hovered, when an empty string "" is passed the behavior of the widget is to hide the selection on hover and follow the hovering over the widget
width - Width of image in px (applies to all three images)
height - Height of image in px (applies to all three images)
Method Detail

addInputTag

public void addInputTag(java.lang.String name)
Adds a hidden input tag to this widget with the attribute name. Adding an input tag makes it possible to use this widget in a form context. The name is the name as visible within the form context.

Parameters:
name - Name for the input property

public void removeRatingListerner(RatingListener listener)
Removes the listener.

Parameters:
listener - Removes the RatingListener

setReadOnly

public void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
Sets the rating selection to read only if argument is true, and if false makes setting new rating possible. The default value behavior of the Rating is that the rating can be set.

Parameters:
readOnly - If true make read only else make possible to set rating

setSelectedVisibileOnHover

public void setSelectedVisibileOnHover(boolean visible)
This method changes the hover behavior of the widget. When visible is set to true when a user hovers over the widget the current selection remains visible and the rating hovered by the user is shown using the hover images (if present, otherwise the same behavior as setting false. When visible is set to false the current selection is not shown when the user hovers over the widget, instead the selection follows the hover. If a hover image is set this image is shown when hovering else the selection image is shown.

Parameters:
visible - If true current selection remains visible when user hovers over widget

setTitles

public void setTitles(java.lang.String[] titles)
Sets the titles on all rating items. The title will be visible to the user when the user hovers over a particular selection item. The String array must contain as many values as the number of possible ratings.

Parameters:
titles - Array of titles
